text: Anyone around to suggest a few changes/cuts to a deck list? Finally got it to 61 cards but I have no real protection for my combo so I need more

so this is supposed to be a Mechanized prodction Combo deck?
Yeah, I have a feeling I'm missing something obvious as well
I was running more clones at first but it seemed less good the more I went into it, less and less real targets
I'm a little confused about some of the choices
Collective Restraint seems less good
Clever Impersonator
Ah dammit, I keep forgetting that clone
You can copy the Mechanized Production
Paradox Haze
Ooooh, that is one interaction I hadn't thought of
Panharmonicon
I feel like the ensoul artifact effects arent going to be that effective in EDH
similarly resonator
to copy triggered abilities
(when/whenever/at)
If you’re looking to win via the 8, Panharmonicon and Myr Battlesphere along with blink effects
THopter Assembly
Felidar Guardian, DEN, Eldrazi Displacer
those seem a little speificf
Thopter assembly seems less good with Breya on tap though
? speificif?
specific, why not just go for more effects that make more stuff
wait
if this deck’s goal is to win via Mechanized Production, you want to be able to create a ton of tokens in one hit and protect it.
why is Thopter Assembly not good with Breya
it makes 5 thopters
They do by blinking Myr Battlesphere or anything else that makes toeksn
tokens
unless you have a thopter. Get more sac outlets or time seive if you want to run thopter assembly
Hmm, ok, I think I know where I went wrong now, I didn't choose a direction I wanted to go for the win
ok
yeah - if the ‘win the game’ condition of MP is your goal, you need a lot more protection
if you’re ready, use Silence to keep folks off your back while you go off
Use Master Transmuter to get Battlesphere out for 1 U
U
but yeah
I mean 1xU
:wink:
ah
anyways
Silence?
Use Render Silent.
Yup, I was too close to it to see where it needed to go
No - Silence W Instant: Your opponents can’t cast spells this turn.
<@U3L7A68JC> is just trying to find all the ways to prevent opponents from interacting w/ the deck on combo turn
Render Silent only works on a single oppoenent
that
Grand Abolisher, Conquerer’s Flail, etc.
Hm. Ok
Aurelia's Fury, maybe, too.
I do feel like you can protect the combo without resorting to carsd that don't do anything other than that though
Just something in the arsenal.
I’d go with Diabolic Tutor, etc. so you don’t show your hand when you’re looking for your combo pieces.
I think running a couple counterspells will probably be good enough
agreed
The new Disallow would be nice
since it covers a wide-range of problems.
I would also consider Pull from Eternity in case part of your combo gets exiled
that's so narrow
Exile is not uncommon...
I said narrow
it does exactly one thing
that isn't what narrow means, really
But that one thing isn’t really available to him in other ways in his colors
really?
Island does exactly one thing
much better to have redundancy in the combo
Narrow means it works in a small number of cases
I apologize
I agree with keattz
no need for that
Redundancy is better.
Are there other options to Mechanized Production’s win con?
but pull from eternity doesn't provide redundancy
it provides protection from a specific event occurring
yes
Yeah, I agreed with how you used narrow initially, until you clarified and said it only does one thing
ahh
ok
Perhaps it’s more playgroup specific but we see a lot of exile
thanks for clarifying
ok, but why not run something that lets you sac the enchanted card to get it into your GY instead
We need a lot of Rest in Peace, and Leyline of the Void, so that doesn’t help.
I kind of like Disallow right now. It does so much
s/need/see
Disallows great I hope it doesn't get played in standard so they're cheap lol
I got one at prerelease.
I need, like, 1,000 more
Nice, I was super happy to have 2 scrap trawlers in my pool cuz I'm putting that a lot of places too
Arcane Denial is my favorite EDH counterspell but I could see Disallow getting in there too
Disallow is definitely a need for me, the other win con if mech production is exiled is to resolve lattice and sac all the things in a race to the bottom
I'm just glad I got the production in my one pre release, that was lucky
I also considered eldrazi displacer, and might still consider it depending how the mana shapes up
I like displacer in Breya alot
Goes infinite with ashnods altar and Breya but all three pieces are solid parts of the deck on their own
Patrick, for your Mechanized Production deck  you might look at Infinite Reflection and Followed Footsteps.
Of course! Followed footsteps! It's in my Jalira deck

Hey all, iteration over the key word thing from before. My intent right now is to take the key words one step further and actually do more sophisticated definitions of archetypes, not just key words. These definitions of archetypes can be based on a keywords, such as the mention of keywords and the amount of cards of a specific type… and perhaps something else you can think of.

If you guys are bored and want to help out, check this google doc which contains a table. I put a few examples in there to show what i’m trying to do

<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZMdqYvN_PVgQwTdcFqzu6CFvqcGMEXqnOEK0VoqcS3I/edit?usp=sharing>
is “group slug” different from stax/chaos?
I think of mana barbs and havoc frstival for group slug
Its a bit different
Looks cool, have you considered breaking down artifacts into smaller pieces? I'm not actually sure how you'd divide it but it seems like a big category
Group slug, "punisher," is a stax variant.
Agreed. I think there are some similar elements but different styles.
Is that a living document or is that something you're working on yourself?
anyone with link can edit so
I wasn't sure if he wanted us changing it or not
in any case people can discuss things about the table
like the first few thoughts I think of are
idk what a “lands” deck but I think it might be something I usually call a “ramp” deck
I think blink and ETB could be separate archetypes
there’s a question regarding how “unique” an archetype has to be somewhere there
and also a question about how popular it has to be
e.g. idk if “wheels” qualifies as an archetype since afaik it’s basically just nekusar and leovold
Kydele is a wheel deck
Arjun is a wheel deck
Or it will be when I build it
ok
But I take your larger point
haha ok I was worried
like obviously if a certain strategy only exists for 1 commander then it’s not an “archetype"
it’s just how that commander is built sometimes
but 2 commanders?
For sure. I think a lot of the specifics boil down to how deep do we want to get with the data
also “control” could be kinda slippery
but definitely important
I think the problem is the vast amount of types of control.
Mono black control could be an achetype
Please edit it
mono black control and mono blue control are pretty straightforward
Hatebear and/or board control are different from counterspell control.
Don't forget MLD
The best kind of control
Would you say prison/lock down is stax, or a stax variant?
Or is it a variant that's not as differentiated as, say, punisher, so it just gets lumped in?
Would it be better to allow folks to build their own criteria on what they believe a given Archetype is for what they have in mind vs trying to hard link a search?
I think they could be all under stax if we stay fairly generic, but I wouldn't be opposed to having them be their own categories.
I like the idea of super and sub categories.
Nope
Too much work
I probably get asked about superfriends the most. Maybe voltron sometimes.
I think max we need 8 or 9
Just archetypes that people want to hear about. Cant overengineer it
Or it wont get dont or it cant be sustained

Lets just get the clear cut ones out and then we can see what people can ask. The archetype rules are going to be a bit complicated and hard coded so itll be hard to build and interface to let people code custom ones.
Kk
